    "import numpy as np\n",
    "import pandas as pd\n",
    "import matplotlib.pyplot as plt\n",
    "import math\n",
    "%matplotlib inline"
   ]
  },
  {
   "cell_type": "code",
   "execution_count": 2,
   "metadata": {},
   "outputs": [
    {
     "name": "stderr",
     "output_type": "stream",

  {
   "cell_type": "markdown",
   "metadata": {},
   "source": [
    "## Regresión"
   ]
  },
  {
   "cell_type": "code",
   "execution_count": 3,
   "metadata": {},
   "outputs": [
    {
     "data": {
      "image/png": "\n",
      "text/plain": [
       "<Figure size 432x288 with 1 Axes>"
      ]
     },
     "metadata": {
      "needs_background": "light"
     },
     "output_type": "display_data"
    }
   ],
   "source": [
    "n_samples = 60\n",
    "np.random.seed(1234)\n",
    "X = np.random.uniform(-5, 5, n_samples)\n",
    "d = 1./(1 + np.exp(-(1.0 + 1.53 * X))) + 0.05 * np.random.normal(size=n_samples)\n",
    "X = np.array([[e] for e in X])\n",
    "plt.scatter(X, d);"
   ]
  },
  {
   "cell_type": "code",
   "execution_count": 4,
   "metadata": {},
   "outputs": [],
   "source": [
    "%%R\n",
    "##\n",
    "## Esta función entrena el modelo. Retorna una lista\n",
    "## con los pesos optimos w y la evolución del error\n",
    "##\n",
    "##   - x: un dataframe con las variables de entrada\n",
    "##   - d: un vector con la clase a que pertenece cada punto\n",
    "##   - mu: tasa de aprendizaje\n",
    "##   - max_iter: número total de iteraciones\n",
    "##\n",
    "train_perceptron_cont <- function(x, d, mu, max_iter) {\n",
    "    \n",
    "    ## crea un vector columna inicial de ceros \n",
    "    ## para los pesos del perceptrón\n",
    "    w <- matrix(rep(0, ncol(x) + 1), ncol(x) + 1, 1)\n",
    "    \n",
    "    ## agrega una columna de 1s a la matriz de las x    \n",
    "    x <- cbind(rep(1, nrow(x)), x)\n",
    "    \n",
    "    ## convierte el vector de clases a una matriz\n",
    "    ## para faciliar los computos    \n",
    "    d <- matrix(d, length(d), 1)\n",
    "    \n",
    "    ## evolución del error    \n",
    "    history <- c()\n",
    "    \n",
    "    for(i in 1:max_iter) {\n",
    "        ## selecciona aleatoriamente un ejemplo \n",
    "        n <- sample(1:nrow(x), 1)\n",
    "        \n",
    "        ## salida del combiador lineal adaptativo\n",
    "        ## para el ejemplo seleccionado\n",
    "        p <- x[n,] %*% w\n",
    "        \n",
    "        ## aplica la función sigmoidea\n",
    "        p <- (1 / (1 + exp(-p)))[1, 1]\n",
    "        \n",
    "        ## error instántaneo para el ejemplo\n",
    "        ## seleccionado\n",
    "        e <- (d[n] - p)\n",
    "        \n",
    "        ## computa la corrección de los pesos\n",
    "        ##       Esta es la derivada de la función de activación\n",
    "        ##                -->|           |<--\n",
    "        w <- w + 2 * mu * e * p * (1 - p) * matrix(x[n,], nrow(w), 1)\n",
    "\n",
    "        ## almacena el error cuadrático para \n",
    "        ## el patrón seleccionado\n",
    "        history <- c(history, sum(e^2))\n",
    "    }\n",
    "    return(list(w, history))\n",
    "}"
   ]
  },
  {
   "cell_type": "code",
   "execution_count": 5,
   "metadata": {},
   "outputs": [],
   "source": [
    "%%R\n",
    "##\n",
    "## Esta función computa la salida del \n",
    "## perceptrón para una matriz \n",
    "## de variables de entrada x\n",
    "##\n",
    "predict_perceptron_cont <- function(m, x) {\n",
    "    ## agrega la columna de 1s\n",
    "    x <- cbind(rep(1, nrow(x)), x)\n",
    "\n",
    "    ## computa la entrada neta\n",
    "    p <- x %*% m[[1]]\n",
    "    \n",
    "    ## aplica la función sigmoidea \n",
    "    return( 1 / (1 + exp(-p)))\n",
    "}"
   ]
  },
  {
   "cell_type": "code",
   "execution_count": 6,
   "metadata": {},
   "outputs": [
    {
     "data": {
      "image/png": "\n"
     },
     "metadata": {},
     "output_type": "display_data"
    }
   ],
   "source": [
    "%%R\n",
    "##\n",
    "## datos del problema propuesto\n",
    "##\n",
    "x <- c(-6.1807,   1.9568,   1.7484,   1.9741,   5.7746,\n",
    "        2.2450,  -7.8481,  -4.2792,   2.6573,   0.2280,\n",
    "        3.0975,   0.7196,  -3.4763,   6.7749,  -3.3229,\n",
    "        5.3967,  -3.4204,  -3.7309,  -5.0124,  -4.2844)\n",
    "\n",
    "d <- c(-0.0089,   0.9799,   0.9843,   1.0012,   1.0192, \n",
    "        0.9977,  -0.0102,   0.0095,   0.9832,   1.0441,\n",
    "        1.0027,   0.9886,   0.1155,   1.0092,   0.1478, \n",
    "        0.9710,   0.1484,   0.0581,   0.0062,   0.0087)\n",
    "\n",
    "options(repr.plot.width=4, repr.plot.height=4)\n",
    "plot(x, d, type='p', pch=21, bg='blue');"
   ]
  },
  {
   "cell_type": "code",
   "execution_count": 7,
   "metadata": {},
   "outputs": [
    {
     "data": {
      "image/png": "\n"
     },
     "metadata": {},
     "output_type": "display_data"
    }
   ],
   "source": [
    "%%R\n",
    "## El modelo espera una matriz\n",
    "X <- matrix(x, length(x), 1)\n",
    "m <- train_perceptron_cont(X, d, mu=0.05, max_iter=10000)\n",
    "options(repr.plot.width=9, repr.plot.height=4)\n",
    "plot( m[[2]], type = 'l', col = 'blue', ylab='e^2')"
   ]
  },
  {
   "cell_type": "code",
   "execution_count": 8,
   "metadata": {},
   "outputs": [
    {
     "data": {
      "image/png": "\n"
     },
     "metadata": {},
     "output_type": "display_data"
    }
   ],
   "source": [
    "%%R\n",
    "## Ajuste\n",
    "options(repr.plot.width=4, repr.plot.height=4)\n",
    "plot(x, d, type='p', pch=21, bg='blue')\n",
    "x_pred <- matrix(seq(from=-8, to=8, length.out=30), 30, 1)\n",
    "y_pred <- predict_perceptron_cont(m, x_pred)\n",
    "lines(x_pred, y_pred, col='red')"
   ]
  },
  {
   "cell_type": "markdown",
   "metadata": {},
   "source": [
    "### Clasificacioón"
   ]
  },
  {
   "cell_type": "code",
   "execution_count": 9,
   "metadata": {},
   "outputs": [],
   "source": [
    "%%R\n",
    "##\n",
    "## Este código es idéntico al presentado en documentos\n",
    "## anteriores\n",
    "##\n",
    "train_perceptron_con <- function(x, d, mu, max_iter) {\n",
    "    \n",
    "    w <- matrix(rep(0, ncol(x) + 1), ncol(x) + 1, 1)\n",
    "    x <- cbind(rep(1, nrow(x)), x)\n",
    "    d <- matrix(d, length(d), 1)\n",
    "    history <- c()\n",
    "    \n",
    "    for(i in 1:max_iter) {\n",
    "        n <- sample(1:nrow(x), 1)\n",
    "        p <- x[n,] %*% w\n",
    "        p <- 1 / (1 + exp(-p))\n",
    "        e <- d[n] - p\n",
    "        w <- w + 2 * mu * e[1,1] * p[1,1] * (1 - p[1,1]) * matrix(x[n,], nrow(w), 1)\n",
    "        history <- c(history, sum(e^2))\n",
    "    }\n",
    "    return(list(w, history))\n",
    "}\n",
    "\n",
    "predict_perceptron_con <- function(m, x) {\n",
    "    x <- cbind(rep(1, nrow(x)), x)\n",
    "    p <- x %*% m[[1]]\n",
    "    return(1 / (1 + exp(-p)))\n",
    "}"
   ]
  },
  {
   "cell_type": "markdown",
   "metadata": {},
   "source": [
    "#### Estimación de los parámetros del modelo"
   ]
  },
  {
   "cell_type": "code",
   "execution_count": 10,
   "metadata": {},
   "outputs": [],
   "source": [
    "from sklearn.datasets import make_blobs\n",
    "\n",
    "NPOINTS = 150\n",
    "\n",
    "X, d = make_blobs(\n",
    "    n_samples=NPOINTS, \n",
    "    n_features=2,\n",
    "    centers=3,\n",
    "    cluster_std=0.8, \n",
    "    shuffle=False,  \n",
    "    random_state=12345)"
   ]
  },
  {
   "cell_type": "code",
   "execution_count": 11,
   "metadata": {},
   "outputs": [],
   "source": [
    "df = pd.DataFrame(X, columns = ['x1', 'x2'])\n",
    "df['d'] = d"
   ]
  },
  {
   "cell_type": "code",
   "execution_count": 12,
   "metadata": {},
   "outputs": [
    {
     "data": {
      "image/png": "\n"
     },
     "metadata": {},
     "output_type": "display_data"
    }
   ],
   "source": [
    "%%R -i df\n",
    "##\n",
    "## Solución \n",
    "## Se codifica un vector para cada clase.\n",
    "## Se emplea la misma estrategia de One-vs-the-Rest.\n",
    "##\n",
    "A <- ifelse(df$d == 0, 1, 0)\n",
    "B <- ifelse(df$d == 1, 1, 0)\n",
    "C <- ifelse(df$d == 2, 1, 0)\n",
    "            \n",
    "mA <- train_perceptron_con(data.matrix(df[,1:2]), A, mu=0.004, max_iter=10000) \n",
    "mB <- train_perceptron_con(data.matrix(df[,1:2]), B, mu=0.001, max_iter=10000)\n",
    "mC <- train_perceptron_con(data.matrix(df[,1:2]), C, mu=0.002, max_iter=10000)\n",
    "\n",
    "options(repr.plot.width=11, repr.plot.height=4)\n",
    "par(mfrow=c(1,3))\n",
    "plot(mA[[2]], type = 'l', col = 'blue')\n",
    "plot(mB[[2]], type = 'l', col = 'red')\n",
    "plot(mC[[2]], type = 'l', col = 'black')"
   ]
  },
  {
   "cell_type": "markdown",
   "metadata": {},
   "source": [

    "%%R\n",
    "##\n",
    "##  Pronostico para un punto que no pertence\n",
    "##  a la muestra de datos\n",
    "##\n",
    "print(predict_perceptron_con(mA, matrix(c(2.5, -4.0), 1, 2)))\n",
    "print(predict_perceptron_con(mB, matrix(c(2.5, -4.0), 1, 2)))\n",
    "print(predict_perceptron_con(mC, matrix(c(2.5, -4.0), 1, 2)))"
   ]
